weka.distributed.spark.mllib.util

Class MLlibDatasetMaker

  • java.lang.Object
    • weka.distributed.spark.mllib.util.MLlibDatasetMaker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class MLlibDatasetMaker
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Helper class for converting RDDs of Weka Instance objects into RDDs of LabeledPoint, for use by MLlib learning schemes.
    Author:
    Mark Hall (mhall{[at]}pentaho{[dot]}com)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • labeledPointRDDFirstBatch

        public org.apache.spark.api.java.JavaRDD<org.apache.spark.mllib.regression.LabeledPoint> labeledPointRDDFirstBatch(Instances headerWithSummary,
                                                                                                                   org.apache.spark.api.java.JavaRDD<Instance> wekaDataset,
                                                                                                                   boolean replaceMissingValues,
                                                                                                                   PreconstructedFilter preconstructedFilters,
                                                                                                                   java.util.List<StreamableFilter> preprocessors,
                                                                                                                   int maxNominalLabels,
                                                                                                                   boolean generateCategoricalFeaturesMap,
                                                                                                                   CachingStrategy strategy)
                                                                                                            throws weka.distributed.DistributedWekaException
        Convert a RDD<Instance> dataset into a RDD<LabeledPoint> one suitable for use with MLlib learners.
        Parameters:
        headerWithSummary - header of the incoming Instance RDD with summary attributes
        wekaDataset - the RDD<Instance>
        replaceMissingValues - true if missing values should be replaced with mean/mode
        preconstructedFilters - any preconstructed filter(s) to use. These are filtering model(s) that have been learned during a spark job and then encapsulated as a PreconstructedFilter (e.g. the PCA filter learned by the CorrelationMatrixSparkJob).
        preprocessors - any streaming filters to apply on-the-fly as the data is transformed from Instances to LabeledPoints. Can be null if there are no filters to apply.
        maxNominalLabels - the maximum number of nominal labels/categories above which a nominal attribute is to be treated as numeric. Nominal attributes with fewer than this number of values will be binarized via NominalToBinary (unless generateCategoricalFeaturesMap is set to true)
        generateCategoricalFeaturesMap - if true then an index,arity map will be generated for those nominal attributes that meet the maxNominalLabels criterion; if false, then Weka's unsupervised NominalToBinary filter will be used to make numeric indicator attributes for nominals that meet the maxNominalLabels criterion
        strategy - caching strategy to use for the new RDD<LabeledPoint> dataset
        Returns:
        a RDD<LabeledPoint> dataset
        Throws:
        weka.distributed.DistributedWekaException - if a problem occurs

      • labeledPointRDDNextBatch

        public org.apache.spark.api.java.JavaRDD<org.apache.spark.mllib.regression.LabeledPoint> labeledPointRDDNextBatch(org.apache.spark.api.java.JavaRDD<Instance> wekaBatch,
                                                                                                                  CachingStrategy strategy)
                                                                                                           throws weka.distributed.DistributedWekaException
        Create an RDD[LabeledPoint] from an RDD[Instance] as a "next batch" - i.e. using information determined from such a conversion on an initial batch. WARNING: this method is not implemented yet, and I'm not sure whether it is actually necessary :-)
        Parameters:
        wekaBatch - RDD[Instance] batch
        strategy - caching strategy to use
        Returns:
        RDD[LabeledPoint]
        Throws:
        weka.distributed.DistributedWekaException - if a problem occurs

        Vectorize a Weka Instance
        Parameters:
